sentence.text: Polo-like kinase 1 (G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle) is overexpressed in a wide spectrum of human tumors, being frequently considered as an oncogene and an attractive cancer target.

entity.text: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: In vivo, G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle overexpression prevents the development of positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-induced and signal transduction-induced mammary gland tumors, in the presence of increased rates of chromosome instability.

entity.text: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: In patients, G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle overexpression correlates with improved survival in specific breast cancer subtypes.

entity.text: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: Therefore, despite the therapeutic benefits of inhibiting G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle due to its essential role in tumor cell cycles, Plk1 overexpression has tumor-suppressive properties by perturbing mitotic progression and cytokinesis

entity.text: G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle
